The incident involving the Australian te: Sam Kanizay, soaking his feet in the water at a Melbourne beach and experiencing excessive bleeding was verified as a real event.
Marine scientists examined the critters: not sea lice as initially thought.
The number of bites sustained by Sam Kan: and it was suggested that a swarm of sea fleas might have been attracted to a cut in his skin or a fish carcass they were feeding on.
The expert: Dr. Genefor Walker-Smith, confirmed that while sea fleas can feed on human flesh, there was no cause for alarm, and Sam Kanizay is expected to make a full recovery.
